common_issues.title: PiecesOS boot-up and responsiveness issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with PiecesOS becoming unresponsive during launch or after update prompts. This includes freezing, long boot times, and failure to fully initialize. Proposed solutions involve restarting the application, reinstalling, or updating to the latest version (11.1.1). However, some users continue to face issues even after trying these solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
related_issues.text:
Pieces app goes unresponsive on opening and every 5sec. Can't use it at all in any way
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces app goes unresponsive and freezes a lot when trying to do anything, like trying to type in copilot chat or navigating through the menus. Can't use pieces app at all! Tried reinstalling it, but it made no difference. Desktop app version is 3.3.6

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e75595c0-31c8-4560-b08b-9ad3de8af6ab
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points Raised:**

* The user, 94tejas, created an issue on February 9, 2025.
* The issue details are not provided in the conversation excerpt.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the appropriate team member.

* The specific problem the user is facing is not mentioned in the conversation excerpt.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* The Pieces Support Bot suggests some resources that might be helpful to the user, including existing related issues, documentation, and Youtube channel.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is asked to expect a follow-up within the next 24 hours.
* The outcome of the issue remains unclear from the conversation excerpt.

**Additional Notes:**

* It's important to note that the conversation excerpt only includes the initial message from the Pieces Support Bot. 
* It's possible that further discussion and updates have occurred after this initial message, which are not included in the excerpt.

Unable to open Pieces Copilot Service
Error: Bad state: GetIt: Object/factory with type PiecesWebSocketCreator is not registered inside GetIt. 
(Did you accidentally do GetIt sl=GetIt.instance(); instead of GetIt sl=GetIt.instance;
Did you forget to register it?)

Succeeded: false
Path:

User: Anonymous

Local Port: 39301

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## PiecesOS Issue Summary for 2025-02-05 and 2025-02-06

### Key Points Raised:

* **Long boot time for PiecesOS**: Several users reported experiencing a long boot time for PiecesOS, with some instances taking several minutes.
* **PiecesOS not appearing in the system tray**: Some users reported that the PiecesOS system tray icon was not appearing, even though the `os_server.exe` process was running in the background.
* **Handshake error**: A user encountered a "Handshake error in client" message when attempting to launch PiecesOS.
* **Specific hardware and software configurations**: The issue appeared to occur on a variety of hardware configurations, with some users reporting using older processors or Windows installations, while others used newer systems.

### Problems Identified:

* **Potential slow migration process during major data migration**: Mark at Pieces identified that the long boot time might be due to a slow migration of data during the upgrade to version 11.1.0, which involved migrating data from a previous stack to a new one.
* **Possible issues with the app installer**: Mark at Pieces suggested trying a different app installer version to address potential issues with the original installer.
* **Incomplete PiecesOS launch**: Jason and Shamas reported issues where PiecesOS would launch partially but not completely, with the system tray icon missing and PFD unable to connect.
* **Handshake errors**: Shamas encountered a handshake error during launch, which may have been due to various factors such as location or server access.

### Solutions Proposed/Implemented:

* **Restarting PiecesOS**: Mark at Pieces suggested restarting PiecesOS after a few minutes to allow for the data migration to complete. Alternatively, a system restart might help as well.
* **Trying the alternative app installer**: Mark at Pieces suggested trying the appInstaller build to see if it resolved the issues faced by some users.
* **Uninstalling and reinstalling PiecesOS**: Nathan at Pieces suggested uninstalling and reinstalling PiecesOS to potentially fix the incomplete launch issues experienced by Jason and Shamas.
* **Providing system information**: Nathan also requested additional information such as the user's location, CPU name and version, and screenshots of specific files to help diagnose the problem further.
* **Updating to version 11.1.1**: Mark at Pieces announced a new build (11.1.1) addressing the reported issues. Users were encouraged to update and report any remaining problems.

### Current Status/Outcome:

* **Potential resolution for long boot time**: Restarting PiecesOS or updating to version 11.1.1 might resolve the long boot time issue.
* **Mixed results for incomplete launches**: While Shamas confirmed the update to 11.1.1 fixed their issue, Jason reported that the problem persisted for them even after updating.
* **Handshake error**: The solution for the handshake error experienced by Shamas remains unclear, but location or server access issues may be potential causes.
* **Need for further investigation**: Additional investigation is needed to understand the root cause and potential solutions for Jason's issue with incomplete launches.

## Additional Notes:

* This summary primarily focuses on the issues raised and discussed on February 5th and 6th, 2025, within the GitHub issue thread.
* The summary is intended to provide a concise overview of the key points, problems, solutions, and current status of the reported issues. 
* Further information and context may be available within the full GitHub issue thread for those interested in a deeper understanding of the discussions and solutions.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS launch and boot-up issues
common_issues.description: Users reported various issues with PiecesOS, including long boot times, failure to launch completely, and system tray icon not appearing. Suggested solutions included restarting PiecesOS, trying alternative app installers, reinstalling the application, and updating to the latest version (11.1.1).

## GitHub Issue Summary:

**Key points:**

* User (@WhyQwerty23811) reported an issue with accessing PiecesOS or the desktop.
* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces support team.
* The Pieces support bot provided helpful resources while awaiting a follow-up.
* Mark-at-Pieces clarified the hosting of Pieces, indicating it is hosted over 39300 and not on 1000 and 3000.

**Problems identified:**

* User was unable to access PiecesOS or the desktop.
* Possible confusion about the hosting address of Pieces.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The support team will investigate the reported issue further.
* Mark-at-Pieces provided clarification on the hosting of Pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is under investigation by the Pieces support team.
* The user is awaiting a follow-up.

**Additional notes:**

* The exact nature of the user's issue is unclear from the provided conversation excerpt.
* The outcome of the investigation and any implemented solutions are unknown.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS won't run
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS won't run
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.1.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Cannot launch Pieces for Developers.  The launcher can't find PiecesOS.  If try to launch PiecesOS from the Pieces Suite it says its already running.  I don't see it in the Systray.  I've Repairing, Resetting, and Reinstalling.

* The issue was automatically triaged and routed to the Pieces team.
* The bot suggested some related issues and helpful resources.

**Problems Identified:**

* The specific problem faced by JasonDWilson is unclear from the conversation.
* The user might have been experiencing issues similar to those mentioned in the suggested related issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark-at-pieces linked a related ticket with debugging steps.
* They offered a call for further assistance if needed.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Mark-at-pieces closed the issue.
* It is unclear whether JasonDWilson resolved the problem or required further assistance.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation took place on February 5, 2025.
* The specific issue being discussed is not explicitly stated in the conversation.

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Boot and Launch Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported long boot times, failure to launch, and missing system tray icons.  Suggested solutions included restarting PiecesOS, trying alternative installers, reinstalling the application, and updating to the latest version (11.1.1).

related_issues.title: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0
related_issues.text: Unable to Boot PiecesOS on Macos(Arm architecture) After updating to 11.1.0 If you cannot open PiecesOS after updating to 11.1.0 and you are on an arm Machine M1, M2, M3,...etc then it is likely that you accidentally installed the intel version of the application. If you are Unsure. Please uninstall Pieces OS from your applications folder and reinstall from https://docs.pieces.app/installation-getting-started/macos (Arm == Apple Silicon) You can tell if you are working with Arm architecture if you see something that resembles this within your 'About this Mac' If you are still having issues after trying these steps please feel free to add a comment on this issue and schedule a time on my calendar here. https://calendar.app.google/MGd9i5gELtiDjWZm8 No comments found on this issue.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Issues and Errors
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing various issues with the Pieces Desktop app, including account linking problems, application crashes, and unresponsiveness.  Suggested solutions include waiting for the new auth service rollout, checking for conflicting processes, and reinstalling or resetting the app.  Support is available via GitHub, Discord, and direct calls.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop app, account linking never acheived for several years?
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have been experiencing an issue with the Pieces Desktop app where I am unable to link both my Google and GitHub accounts simultaneously. Despite following the documentation and contacting support multiple times, over several years, the issue persists?

Steps to Reproduce:

Log in to the Pieces Desktop app using my Google account.
Go to Settings > Account & Cloud Integrations.
Click on the GitHub integration and authenticate via GitHub.
After authentication, I am redirected back to the app, and only the GitHub account is linked.
Attempt to add the Google account again, authenticate, and return to the app.
Only the Google account is now linked, and the GitHub account is unlinked.
Expected Behavior: Both Google and GitHub accounts should be linked simultaneously.

Actual Behavior: Only one account (either Google or GitHub) is linked at a time. The other account gets unlinked when attempting to add both.

Additional Information:

I have been using the same email address for both Google and GitHub accounts since day one.
I have contacted support in the past, and they have reset data on their end, but the issue persists.
Disabling the GitHub email privacy option did not resolve the issue.
Environment:

Additional Context: I would prefer to resolve this issue over GitHub or Discord rather than booking a call, as past contact attempts via calls have not resolved the issue.  Also its not a critical requirement for me to use the app but it would be nice to one day be able to actually use this very old feature.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points Raised:**

* @johnkennyuk experienced issues linking their personal and Github accounts.
* Account linking flow was identified as cumbersome and needing replacement.
* Capitalization inconsistency in email addresses was suspected as a potential cause.

**Problems Identified:**

* Existing account linking flow was not user-friendly.
* Capitalization difference in registered email addresses potentially prevented proper merging.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Mark from Pieces offered to personally merge the accounts through a meeting or email exchange.
* Screen recording was requested from @johnkennyuk to identify further issues.
* New auth service was mentioned to be in progress for smoother linking and email handling.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Temporary account linking solution provided through manual merging.
* Resolution postponed to new auth service rollout (end of February 2025).

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation highlights the importance of email case sensitivity during account linking.
* There was an acknowledgment of the inconvenience caused by the current system and assurance of improvement with the upcoming new service.

common_issues.title: Ollama Installation and Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties downloading, installing, and running Ollama models, particularly on Linux systems. This appears to be related to snap confinement issues and dependencies. Proposed solutions include updating to the latest Pieces OS version (11.1.0 or higher) and waiting for upcoming patches addressing snap-related challenges.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8e93857a-de7e-4e62-b3d0-c6a68b48631e
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* @surya-sengupta reported an issue with Ollama installation.
* The bot suggested relevant resources and existing issues for troubleshooting.
* Brian from Pieces team acknowledged the issue and suggested updating to version 11.1.0 for improved stability.

**Problems identified:**

* Ollama installation was failing.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update to Pieces OS version 11.1.0 for improved Ollama stability.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is unclear whether @surya-sengupta updated to the recommended version or if the issue was resolved.

**Additional notes:**

* The issue seems related to other Ollama installation problems on Linux reported in other issues.

related_issues.title: Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
related_issues.text:
Ollama Fails to Install on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

User reports immediate "Ollama failed to install" diaglog upon clicking install Ollama install button in Pieces desktop app
## Ollama Installation Issue Summary:

**Key Points:**

* The `Ollama` LLM download and installation process is failing on Ubuntu systems where Pieces-OS is installed as a snap package.
* The problem is related to snap's confined environment lacking access to `curl`, which is required for the LLM retrieval.
* Solution involves modifying the snap's definition file to include `curl` as a dependency and adjusting the installation workflow to work within the sandbox.

**Solutions:**

* Patches are under development to allow Ollama usage from within the snap's sandboxed environment.
* Progress on the patch faced some delays but has now resumed and is expected to be released next week.

**Current Status:**

* The patch is currently under development and is targeted for inclusion in the next release.
* Users can expect an update regarding the fix in the near future.

**Additional Information:**

* Manually downloading the model won't resolve the issue as it also affects inference.
* The latest available version on Ubuntu as of January 23 still contains this issue.
* Users expressing concerns about cloud LLMs accessing their data are encouraged to wait for the official patch to ensure safe and controlled local LLM execution.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The user is asked to expect a follow-up within the next 24 hours.
* The outcome of the issue remains unclear from the conversation excerpt.

**Additional Notes:**

* It's important to note that the conversation excerpt only includes the initial message from the Pieces Support Bot. 
* It's possible that further discussion and updates have occurred after this initial message, which are not included in the excerpt.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolution of PiecesOS boot and launch issues:** This appears to be the most common problem, impacting users across different operating systems. Focus on resolving the underlying causes of long boot times, incomplete launches, and system tray icon issues.

**Improve Ollama installation and functionality:** Address the difficulties users face when downloading, installing, and running Ollama models, especially on Linux. Prioritize resolving snap confinement issues and dependencies.

**Investigate and resolve Pieces Desktop app issues:** Address account linking problems, application crashes, and unresponsiveness reported by users. Ensure the new auth service rollout effectively resolves account linking challenges.

**Proactively monitor and address common issues:** Use the insights from this report to proactively monitor for emerging issues and provide timely solutions. Update documentation and FAQs to address common problems and questions.

**Improve communication and transparency:** Keep users informed about the status of known issues, planned fixes, and estimated resolution times. This will help manage expectations and reduce support requests.
